intro: Dasistepha asclepiadea, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its milky sap contains toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful if ingested. It is often used in traditional medicine, though its use is limited due to its poisonous properties.
